channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- ansible
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- ansible

item.title: CVE-2019-14858|2024-08-05T00:26:39.087Z -- red%20hat -- ansible
item.description: A vulnerability was found in Ansible engine 2.x up to 2.8 and Ansible tower 3.x up to 3.5. When a module has an argument_spec with sub parameters marked as no_log, passing an invalid parameter name to the module will cause the task to fail before the no_log options in the sub parameters are processed. As a result, data in the sub parameter fields will not be masked and will be displayed if Ansible is run with increased verbosity and present in the module invocation arguments for the task.

item.title: CVE-2019-14905|2024-08-05T00:34:52.317Z -- red%20hat -- ansible
item.description: A vulnerability was found in Ansible Engine versions 2.9.x before 2.9.3, 2.8.x before 2.8.8, 2.7.x before 2.7.16 and earlier, where in Ansible's nxos_file_copy module can be used to copy files to a flash or bootflash on NXOS devices. Malicious code could craft the filename parameter to perform OS command injections. This could result in a loss of confidentiality of the system among other issues.

item.title: CVE-2019-14846|2024-08-05T00:26:39.176Z -- red%20hat -- ansible
item.description: In Ansible, all Ansible Engine versions up to ansible-engine 2.8.5, ansible-engine 2.7.13, ansible-engine 2.6.19, were logging at the DEBUG level which lead to a disclosure of credentials if a plugin used a library that logged credentials at the DEBUG level. This flaw does not affect Ansible modules, as those are executed in a separate process.

item.title: CVE-2019-14864|2024-08-05T00:26:39.116Z -- red%20hat -- ansible
item.description: Ansible, versions 2.9.x before 2.9.1, 2.8.x before 2.8.7 and Ansible versions 2.7.x before 2.7.15, is not respecting the flag no_log set it to True when Sumologic and Splunk callback plugins are used send tasks results events to collectors. This would discloses and collects any sensitive data.

item.title: CVE-2018-16876|2024-08-05T10:32:54.241Z -- red%20hat -- ansible
item.description: ansible before versions 2.5.14, 2.6.11, 2.7.5 is vulnerable to a information disclosure flaw in vvv+ mode with no_log on that can lead to leakage of sensible data.

item.title: CVE-2018-16859|2024-08-05T10:32:54.246Z -- red%20hat -- ansible
item.description: Execution of Ansible playbooks on Windows platforms with PowerShell ScriptBlock logging and Module logging enabled can allow for 'become' passwords to appear in EventLogs in plaintext. A local user with administrator privileges on the machine can view these logs and discover the plaintext password. Ansible Engine 2.8 and older are believed to be vulnerable.
